title: Sint Maarten
summary: Sint Maarten (Dutch: Sint Maarten, pronounced [sɪntˈmaːrtə(n)] (listen)) is a constituent country of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in the Caribbean.[4] With a population of 41,486[1] as of January 2019 on an area of 34 km2 (13 sq mi), it encompasses the southern 40% of the divided island of Saint Martin, while the northern 60% of the island constitutes the French overseas collectivity of Saint Martin. Sint Maarten's capital is Philipsburg.[4] Collectively, Sint Maarten and the other Dutch islands in the Caribbean are often called the Dutch Caribbean.
